alert.note: Alert for Hardin; Jasper; Marshall (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 4:45PM CDT until March 31 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM CDT FOR NORTHERN POWESHIEK...EASTERN MARSHALL...EASTERN HARDIN...BLACK HAWK...TAMA...BREMER...EASTERN FRANKLIN...GRUNDY...BUTLER... NORTHEASTERN JASPER AND SOUTHEASTERN CERRO GORDO COUNTIES... At 445 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Greene to near Dike to 6 miles north of Grinnell, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Dike, New Hartford, Clarksville, Uni-Dome And McLeod Center, Cedar Falls, Hudson, Waterloo Municipal Airport, Holiday Lake, George Wyth State Park, Crossroads Mall, Plainfield, Chelsea, Waterloo, Evansdale, Elk Run Heights, Raymond, Dunkerton, Jesup, Frederika and Sumner. This includes Interstate 380 between mile markers 56 and 73. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central, north central and northeastern Iowa. Intense thunderstorm lines can produce brief tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, it is best to move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. These storms may cause serious injury and significant property damage.
